HintPath.description: Relative or absolute path to the assembly

SpecificVersion.description: Whether only the version in the fusion name should be referenced

Private.description: Whether the reference should be copied to the output folder

EmbedInteropTypes.description: Whether the types in this reference need to embedded into the target assembly - interop assemblies only

RequiredTargetFramework.description: The minimum required target framework version in order to use this assembly as a reference

SDKReference.description: Reference to a Windows 8.1 extension SDK

VersionMajor.description: Major part of the version number

VersionMinor.description: Minor part of the version number

EmbedInteropTypes.description: Whether the types in this reference need to embedded into the target assembly - interop assemblies only (optional)

Version.description: The version of the NuGet package dependency

DotNetCliToolReference.description: The CLI tool that the user wants restored in the context of the project

Version.description: The version of the NuGet package dependency

ProjectConfiguration.description: Defines a Configuration|Platform combination that may be used to build this project

Configuration.description: The configuration part of the project configuration

Platform.description: The platform part of the project configuration

ProjectCapability.description: Project Capability that may activate design-time components in an IDE

NativeReference.description: Reference to a native manifest file, or to a file that contains a native manifest

ReferenceOutputAssembly.description: Whether the outputs of the project referenced should be passed to the compiler

SpecificVersion.description: Whether the exact version of the assembly should be used

Targets.description: Semicolon separated list of targets in the referenced projects that should be built. Default is the value of `$(ProjectReferenceBuildTargets)` whose default is blank, indicating the default targets.

OutputItemType.description: Item type to emit target outputs into. Default is blank. If the Reference metadata is set to `true` (default) then target outputs will become references for the compiler.

Compile.description: Source files to be passed to the compiler

AutoGen.description: Whether file was generated from another file

EmbeddedResource.description: Resources to be embedded in the generated assembly

Content.description: Files that are not compiled, but may be embedded or published

CopyToPublishDirectory.description: Whether to copy the file to the publish directory

type.PreserveNewest: Copy the file if it is newer than the existing copy

Page.description: XAML files that are converted to binary and compiled into the assembly

Resource.description: File that is compiled into the assembly

ApplicationDefinition.description: XAML file that contains the application definition, only one can be defined

None.description: Files that should have no role in the build process

BaseApplicationManifest.description: The base application manifest for the build. Contains ClickOnce security information.

Folder.description: Folder on disk to display in the IDE

Import.description: Assemblies whose namespaces should be imported by the Visual Basic compiler

WebReferences.description: Name of Web References folder to display in user interface

WebReferenceUrl.description: Represents a reference to a web service

TargetPlatform.description: Target platform in the form of "[Identifier], Version=[Version]", for example, "Windows, Version=8.0"

FileWrites.description: Files to track for incremental clean

properties.VisualStudioVersion: The version of Visual Studio into which this project is loaded
properties.MinimumVisualStudioVersion: The minimum version of Visual Studio required to open this project
properties.AppDesignerFolder: Name of folder for Application Designer

AssemblyOriginatorKeyFile.description: The file that contains the key used to sign the assembly

properties.AutoGenerateBindingRedirects: Indicates whether BindingRedirect elements should be automatically generated for referenced assemblies.

CheckForOverflowUnderflow.description: Whether the compiler should check for integer overflow and underflow

properties.CodePage: The codepage the compiler should use when reading source files

ConsolePause.description: Whether the IDE should keep the console open after executing a console application

Configuration.description: The configuration that is being used to build the project, for example "Debug" or "Release"

DebugType.description: What kind of debug information to emit

DelaySign.description: Reserve space for a signature so the assembly can be signed later

DisableFastUpToDateCheck.description: Whether Visual Studio should do its own faster up-to-date check before Building, rather than invoke MSBuild to do a possibly more accurate one. You would set this to false if you have a heavily customized build process and builds in Visual Studio are not occurring when they should.

DocumentationFile.description: Filename for the xml documentation file

ErrorReport.description: Reporting behavior for internal compiler errors

type.prompt: Open a dialog asking whether you want to report the internal compiler error
type.queue: Queue the internal compiler error reports and prompt you later
type.send: Automatically report the internal compiler error to Microsoft
type.none: Do not report internal compiler error

FileAlignment.description: Override the boundary on which the compiler aligns sections of the output assembly

FrameworkPathOverride.description: Overrides the path to the target framework

GeneratePackageOnBuild.description: Value indicating whether a NuGet package will be generated when the project is built

Prefer32Bit.description: Mark the executable as preferring to run on a 32-bit runtime when on a 64-bit OS

HighEntropyVA.description: Mark the executable as able to run with Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) enable

NoStdLib.description: Whether to disable automatic referencing of standard libraries such as mscorlib

properties.NoWarn: Comma separated list of disabled warnings

Optimize.description: Whether the compiler should optimize the output

OutputPath.description: Path to output folder, with trailing slash

OutputType.description: The type of output from the compiler, such as an executable or library

properties.PackageTargetFallback: Allows packages using alternative monikers to be referenced in this project, which include older (e.g. dnxcore50, dotnet5.x) and Portable Class Library names

Platform.description: The platform that is being used to build the project, for example "AnyCPU" or "x86"

PlatformTarget.description: The platform that the executable targets

type.anycpu: Runs on a 64-bit runtime if available, else 32-bit
type.anycpu32bitpreferred: Runs on a 32-bit runtime if available, else 64-bit
type.x64: Only runs on a 64-bit runtime on x86 processors
type.x86: Only runs on a 32-bit runtime on x86 processors

properties.PostBuildEvent: Command line to be run at the end of build
properties.PreBuildEvent: Command line to be run at the start of build

PreserveCompilationContext.description: Value indicating whether reference assemblies can be used in dynamic compilation

ProjectGuid.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies the project within the solution

ProjectTypeGuids.description: A list of GUIDs that activate design-time capabilities in an IDE

ReferencePath.description: Semi-colon separated list of folders to search during reference resolution

properties.RepositoryType: The type of the repository where the project is stored (e.g. git)

RepositoryUrl.description: The URL for the repository where the project is stored

properties.RootNamespace: The root namespace to use for new files

RuntimeIdentifier.description: Runtime identifier supported by the project (e.g. win10-x64)

RuntimeIdentifiers.description: Semi-colon separated list of runtime identifiers supported by the project (e.g. win10-x64;osx.10.11-x64;ubuntu.16.04-x64)

RunCodeAnalysis.description: Indicates whether to run Code Analysis during the build

properties.StartupObject: Type that contains the main entry point

TargetFramework.description: Short moniker of the framework that this project targets, e.g. `netstandard2.0`

TargetFrameworks.description: List of short monikers for the frameworks that this project targets, for example `netstandard2.0;net461)`

TargetFrameworkIdentifier.description: The identity of framework that this project targets, for example `.NETFramework`

TargetFrameworkVersion.description: The version of the framework that this project targets, for example `v4.0`

TargetFrameworkProfile.description: The profile of the framework that this project targets, for example `Profile259`

TargetFrameworkMoniker.description: The full moniker for of the framework that this project targets, combining the identifier, version and profile

TreatWarningsAsErrors.description: Whether to treat warnings as errors

UTF8Output.description: Whether the compile should use UTF8 encoding for its console output

WarningLevel.description: What level of warnings the compiler should emit, between 0 and 4 inclusive

properties.WarningsAsErrors: Comma separated list of warning numbers to treat as errors
properties.Win32ResourceFile: A Win32 resource file to embed into the compiler output
properties.Win32Manifest: A Win32 resource file to embed into the compiler output

TargetPath.description: Absolute path of the project's primary output

TargetName.description: Base name of the project's primary output

TargetExt.description: File extension of the project's primary output

TargetDir.description: Directory path of the project's primary output

ProjectFileName.description: Name of the project, formed by appending the extension to the base name

SolutionDir.description: The directory containing the solution file

SolutionName.description: Base name of the solution file, without its extension

SolutionExt.description: The extension of the solution file

SolutionFileName.description: Name of the solution file, formed by appending the extension to the base name

SolutionPath.description: Absolute path of the solution file

DefaultLanguageSourceExtension.description: The default extension for source files

BaseOutputPath.description: The base directory for build outputs. The build outputs will be in a configuration-specific subdirectory.

BaseIntermediateOutputPath.description: The base directory for intermediate build outputs. The build output will be in a configuration-specific subdirectory.

IntermediateOutputPath.description: The configuration-specific directory in which intermediate build outputs are stored

MSBuildAllProjects.description: List of all project files. Targets can use this as an input to trigger rebuilds when these files change, and targets and props files can add themselves to be included in this behavior.

ExternalConsole.description: Whether to close the external console after running a console application in the IDE

Configurations.description: The values that the IDE should list for the `$(Configuration)` property

Platforms.description: The values that the IDE should list for the `$(Platform)` property

metadata.#: Metadata that controls how assets are consumed/propagated from a reference

IncludeAssets.description: Assets that will be consumed by the project

ExcludeAssets.description: Assets that will not be consumed by the project

PrivateAssets.description: Assets that will be consumed by the project but won't flow to its parent

metadata.#: Metadata that applies to files that are generated by tools
metadata.Generator: Name of any file generator that is run on this item
metadata.LastGenOutput: File that was created by any file generator that was run on this item
metadata.CustomToolNamespace: Namespace into which any file generator that is run on this item should create code

metadata.#: This technically applies to everything declared outside of a target

Visible.description: Whether the item should be displayed in the IDE solution tree

CopyToOutputDirectory.description: Whether to copy the file to the output directory

type.PreserveNewest: Copy the file if it is newer than the existing copy

metadata.DependentUpon: The file under which this file should be grouped in the IDE solution tree

metadata.#: This technically applies to everything declared outside of a target
metadata.Link: Notional path within project to display if the file is physically located outside of the project file's cone (optional)

targets.Cleans: Deletes the project's intermediate and final outputs
targets.Rebuild: Cleans and then rebuilds the project
targets.Restore: Restores NuGet packages required to build the project
targets.Publish: Prepares the project's outputs for distribution and copies them to the publish folder
targets.ResolveReferences: Resolves the assembly and project references
targets.ResolveAssemblyReferences: Resolves assembly references to assemblies and satellite files
targets.ResolveProjectReferences: Builds referenced projects and resolves their outputs
targets.AssignLinkMetadata: Assigns default values for the `Link` metadata on several item types
targets.AssignProjectConfiguration: Assigns configurations to project references based on the solutiom configuration mappings
targets.GetTargetPath: Called by a referencing project to determine the path to the project's output
targets.PrepareResources: Prepares resources for the Compile step
targets.AssignTargetPaths: Assigns `%(TargetPath)` metadata on several item types
targets.Compile: Resolves references and compiles the assembly
targets.CoreCompile: Invokes the compiler to compile the assembly
targets.GenerateTargetFrameworkMonikerAttribute: Injects a source file containing the TargetFrameworkMonikerAttribute
targets.CreateSatelliteAssemblies: Creates satellite assemblies for the cultures in the resources
targets.ComputeIntermediateSatelliteAssemblies: Determines the paths for the satellite assemblies to be created
targets.PrepareForRun: Copies updated build outputs to the output directory
targets.CopyFilesToOutputDirectory: Copies updated assemblies and other outputs to the output directory
targets.GetCopyToOutputDirectoryItems: Gets items to be copied to the output directory from this project and its immediate references
targets.GetCopyToPublishDirectoryItems: Gets items to be copied to the publish directory from this project and its immediate references
targets.IncrementalClean: Deletes any files produced by a prior build that are not in the FileWrites items for the current build
targets.CleanReferencedProjects: Call the Clean target on referenced projects
targets.CleanPublishFolder: Delete the contents of the publish folder
targets.BeforeCompile: Runs before the Compile target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterCompile: Runs after the Compile target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforeBuild: Runs before the Build target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterBuild: Runs after the Build target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforeRebuild: Runs before the Rebuild target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterRebuild: Runs after the Rebuild target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforeClean: Runs before the Clean target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterClean: Runs after the Clean target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforePublish: Runs before the Publish target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterPublish: Runs after the Publish target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforeResolveReferences: Runs before the ResolveReferences target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterResolveReferences: after before the ResolveReferences target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.BeforeResGen: Runs before the ResGen target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
targets.AfterResGen: Runs after the ResGen target. Can be safely overridden in project files.
